00007 #ifndef __IM_CONVERT_H
00008 #define __IM_CONVERT_H

00017 /** \defgroup convert Image Conversion
00018  * \par
00019  * Converts one type of image into another. Can convert between color modes
00020  * and between data types.
00021  * \par
00022  * See \ref im_convert.h
00023  * \ingroup imgclass */
00024 
00025 
00026 /** Complex to real conversions
00027  * \ingroup convert */
00028 enum imComplex2Real 
00029 {
00030   IM_CPX_REAL, 
00031   IM_CPX_IMAG, 
00032   IM_CPX_MAG, 
00033   IM_CPX_PHASE
00034 };
00035 
00036 /** Predefined Gamma factors. Gamma can be any real number.
00037  * When gamma<0 use logarithmic, when gamma>0 use exponential.
00038  * gamma(x,g) = ((e^(g*x))-1)/(exp(g)-1)
00039  * gamma(x,g) = (log((g*x)+1))/(log(g+1))
00040  * \ingroup convert */
00041 enum imGammaFactor
00042 {
00043   IM_GAMMA_LINEAR   = 0,
00044   IM_GAMMA_LOGLITE  = -10,
00045   IM_GAMMA_LOGHEAVY = -1000,
00046   IM_GAMMA_EXPLITE  = 2,
00047   IM_GAMMA_EXPHEAVY = 7
00048 };
00049 
00050 /** Predefined Cast Modes \n
00051  * See also \ref color Color Manipulation, Color Component Intervals section.
00052  * \ingroup convert */
00053 enum imCastMode
00054 {
00055   IM_CAST_MINMAX, /**< scan for min and max values.  */
00056   IM_CAST_FIXED,  /**< use predefied min-max values. */
00057   IM_CAST_DIRECT, /**< direct type cast the value.   */
00058   IM_CAST_USER    /**< user attributes called "UserMin" and "UserMax", both float values. */
00059 };
00060 
00061 /** Changes the image data type, using a complex2real conversion, 
00062  * a gamma factor, and an abssolute mode (modulus). \n
00063  * When demoting the data type the function will scan source for min/max values or use fixed values (cast_mode)
00064  * to scale the result according to the destiny range. \n
00065  * Except complex to real that will use only the complex2real conversion. \n
00066  * Images must be of the same size and color mode. \n
00067  * Returns IM_ERR_NONE, IM_ERR_DATA or IM_ERR_COUNTER, see also \ref imErrorCodes.
00068  * See also \ref imComplex2Real, \ref imGammaFactor and \ref imCastMode.
00069  *
00070  * \verbatim im.ConvertDataType(src_image: imImage, dst_image: imImage, cpx2real: number, gamma: number, abssolute: boolean, cast_mode: number) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00071  * \verbatim im.ConvertDataTypeNew(image: imImage, data_type: number, cpx2real: number, gamma: number, abssolute: boolean, cast_mode: number) -> error: number, new_image: imImage  [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00072  * \ingroup convert */
00073 int imConvertDataType(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image, int cpx2real, float gamma, int abssolute, int cast_mode);
00074 
00075 /** Converts one color space to another. Images must be of the same size and data type. \n
00076  * CMYK can be converted to RGB only, and it is a very simple conversion. \n
00077  * All colors can be converted to Binary, the non zero gray values are converted to 1. \n
00078  * RGB to Map uses the median cut implementation from the free IJG JPEG software, copyright Thomas G. Lane. \n
00079  * Alpha channel is considered and Transparency* attributes are converted to alpha channel. \n
00080  * All other color space conversions assume sRGB and CIE definitions. \n
00081  * Returns IM_ERR_NONE, IM_ERR_DATA or IM_ERR_COUNTER, see also \ref imErrorCodes.
00082  *
00083  * \verbatim im.ConvertColorSpace(src_image: imImage, dst_image: imImage) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00084  * \verbatim im.ConvertColorSpaceNew(image: imImage, color_space: number, has_alpha: boolean) -> error: number, new_image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00085  * \ingroup convert */
00086 int imConvertColorSpace(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image);
00087 
00088 /** Converts the image to its bitmap equivalent, 
00089  * uses \ref imConvertColorSpace and \ref imConvertDataType. \n
00090  * Returns IM_ERR_NONE, IM_ERR_DATA or IM_ERR_COUNTER, see also \ref imErrorCodes.
00091  * See also \ref imComplex2Real, \ref imGammaFactor and \ref imCastMode. \n
00092  * The function im.ConvertToBitmapNew uses the default conversion result from \ref imColorModeToBitmap if color_space is nil.
00093  *
00094  * \verbatim im.ConvertToBitmap(src_image: imImage, dst_image: imImage, cpx2real: number, gamma: number, abssolute: boolean, cast_mode: number) -> error: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00095  * \verbatim im.ConvertToBitmapNew(image: imImage, color_space: number, has_alpha: boolean, cpx2real: number, gamma: number, abssolute: boolean, cast_mode: number) -> error: number, new_image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00096  * \ingroup convert */
00097 int imConvertToBitmap(const imImage* src_image, imImage* dst_image, int cpx2real, float gamma, int abssolute, int cast_mode);
00098 
00099 /** Returns an OpenGL compatible data buffer. Also returns the correspondant pixel format. \n
00100  * The memory allocated is stored in the attribute "GLDATA" with BYTE type. And it will exists while the image exists. \n
00101  * It can be cleared by setting the attribute to NULL. \n
00102  * MAP images are converted to RGB, and BINARY images are converted to GRAY.
00103  * Alpha channel is considered and Transparency* attributes are converted to alpha channel.
00104  * So calculate depth from glformat, not from image depth.
00105  *
00106  * \verbatim image:GetOpenGLData() -> gldata: userdata, glformat: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00107  * \ingroup convert */
00108 void* imImageGetOpenGLData(const imImage* image, int *glformat);
00109 
00110 /** Creates an image from an OpenGL data.
00111  *
00112  * \verbatim im.ImageCreateFromOpenGLData(width, height, glformat: number, gldata: userdata) -> image: imImage [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00113  * \ingroup convert */
00114 imImage* imImageCreateFromOpenGLData(int width, int height, int glformat, const void* gldata);
00115 
00116 
00117 /** \defgroup cnvutil Raw Data Conversion Utilities
00118  * \par
00119  * Utilities for raw data buffers.
00120  * \par
00121  * See \ref im_convert.h
00122  * \ingroup imagerep */
00123 
00124 
00125 /** Changes the packing of the data buffer. Both must have the same width, height and data_type. \n
00126  * It can be used to copy data even if depth=1.
00127  * \ingroup cnvutil */
00128 void imConvertPacking(const void* src_data, void* dst_data, int width, int height, int src_depth, int dst_depth, int data_type, int src_is_packed);
00129 
00130 /** Changes in-place a MAP data into a RGB data. The data must have room for the RGB image. \n
00131  * depth can be 3 or 4. count=width*height. \n
00132  * \ingroup cnvutil */
00133 void imConvertMapToRGB(unsigned char* data, int count, int depth, int packed, long* palette, int palette_count);
00134                        
00135 
00136 
00137 /* Converts a RGB bitmap into a map bitmap using the median cut algorithm.
00138  * Used only "im_convertcolor.cpp" implemented in "im_rgb2map.cpp". 
00139  * Internal function kept here because of the compatibility module. 
00140  * Will not be at the documentation. */
00141 int imConvertRGB2Map(int width, int height, 
00142               unsigned char *red, unsigned char *green, unsigned char *blue, 
00143               unsigned char *map, long *palette, int *palette_count);
